title: Linux.Forensics.ProcFD
author: chrisdfir
description:
This artifact collects metadata about open file descriptors from active processes on a Linux system. 
Outputs include regular files, sockets, device files, and deleted files used by each process.

title: Windows.LastDomainUsers
author: AnthoLaMalice
description: Enumerate Domain Users by creation date. This artifact can be used to quickly detect new domain accounts that may have been created by attackers. This artifact must be run on Domain Joined systems with the PowerShell Active Directory module installed.

title: FreeBSD.Sys.Utx
author: Herbert-Karl
description:
Parse the utx file of the system (similar to wtmp on Linux). This covers user sessions, boots, shutdowns and system time changes.
Because FreeBSD discards fields for the entries of the utx file based on type (see `man getutxent`), no direct parsing of the file using "vtypes" is done (too complicated for me to define a structure for parsing), but rather native tools are used for accessing the data.

title: Server.Hunt.Comparison
author: DenKi42
description: This artifact is used to compare other artifacts from two different hunts. The basic idea is that a baseline (Hunt 1) is created from selected artifacts before an attack. A second hunt (Hunt 2) can then be carried out after the attack using the same artifacts. Now, using this script, artifacts from both hunts can be compared. This allows legitimate activities to be filtered out and makes it easier to identify malicious activities in Hunt2.

title: Windows.Sysinternals.PSShutdown
author: iboje
description: PsShutdown is a command-line utility similar to the shutdown utility from the Windows 2000 Resource Kit, but with the ability to do much more. In addition to supporting the same options for shutting down or rebooting the local or a remote computer, PsShutdown can logoff the console user or lock the console (locking requires Windows 2000 or higher). PsShutdown requires no manual installation of client software.

title: Linux.ExtractKthread
author: andy99998
description: This artifact parses `/proc/[0-9]*/status` files and extracts the `ProcessName` and `Kthread` values. Helpful for identifying imposter processes.

title: Linux.Forensics.EnvironmentVariables
author: ibyf0r3ns1cs
description: This artifact detects potential persistence mechanisms on Linux systems by analyzing environment variable files and login scripts.

title: Windows.Veeam.RestorePoints.BackupFiles
author: cybiosity-syn
description: Parses the metadata found in Veeam full backup files (`.vbk`), Veeam incremental backup files (`.vib`) and Veeam reverse incremental backup files (`.vrb`) to extract relevant fields for each Restore Point.

title: Windows.Utils.DefenderExclusion
author: predictiple
description: Adds a Microsoft Defender real-time scanning process exclusion for Velociraptor.

title: Linux.Event.Network.Nethogs
author: misje
description:
Monitor network bandwidth per process, using "nethogs". This artifact will
list all processes that produces (non-local) network traffic on the client,
leveraging the process tracker, and displays the total bytes received and sent
in the given time frame.

title: Linux.Network.Nethogs
author: misje
description:
Monitor network bandwidth per process, using "nethogs". This artifact will
list all processes that produces (non-local) network traffic on the client,
leveraging the process tracker, and displays the total bytes received and sent
in the given time frame.

title: Linux.Applications.Docker.Ps
author: j91321
description: Get Docker containers by connecting to the docker.socket. Same as running `docker ps`

title: Notebooks.Admin.Flows
author: misje
description:
This notebooks lists all recent flows/collections across all orgs on the
platform. It may be used for auditing or as a means of finding a collection
previously scheduled.

title: Generic.Apache.AccessLogs
author: Krishna-23
description: Parses Apache access logs to extract detailed request information.

title: Generic.Events.TrackNetworkConnections
author: sec-hbaer
description:
This artifact is meant for monitoring network connections on clients.
It periodically queries the existing network connections and emits lines for differences (new connections and missing/removed ones).
Network connections are tracked and compared based on following elements: process id, layer 3 protocol, layer 4 protocol, local address used, local port used, remote address used, remote port used.

title: Server.Alerts.TrackNetworkConnections
author: sec-hbaer
description:
This artifact alerts on network connections tracked by Velociraptor on clients.
Requires the client_event artifact 'Generic.Events.TrackNetworkConnections' to be enabled.

title: Windows.EventLogs.DeepBlueCLI
author: AnthoLaMalice
description: DeepBlueCLI - a PowerShell Module for Threat Hunting via Windows Event Logs

title: Windows.Ssh.AuthorizedKeys
author: j91321
description: Find and parse ssh authorized keys files on Windows running OpenSSH service.

title: Windows.EventLogs.SysmonProcessEnriched.yaml
author: zaneGittins
description:
Gather sysmon process creation events from the sysmon operational event log. Enrich with authenticode signature of image and call chain.
Caches authenticode signature by the hash of the image for ClearCacheSeconds (default, 1hr).
Prerequisites: Sysmon, and the process tracker.

title: Linux.Detection.BruteForce
author: RCarras
description:
Linux detection brute force module.
This code is based on https://github.com/RCarras/linforce/blob/main/linforce.sh
   
This module uses btmp/wtmp files to search for possible brute force attacks comparing:

title: Windows.System.Recall.AllWindowEvents
author: zachstanford-cybercx
description: This artefact will read and correlate several tables to do with Microsoft Recall.

title: Windows.System.Recall.WindowCaptureEvent
author: zachstanford-cybercx
description: This artefact will read and correlate several tables to do with Microsoft Recall.

title: Exchange.Windows.EventLogs.Hayabusa.Takajo
author: x0rPE
description:
[Takajo] (https://github.com/Yamato-Security/takajo) is a fast forensics analyzer
for Hayabusa results written in Nim. Takajō means "Falconer" in Japanese
and was chosen as it analyzes Hayabusa's "catches" (results).

title: Exchange.Windows.System.PowerShell.DetectResponder
author: Jbhoohe
description:
This artifact allows to detect responder in the environment
https://tcm-sec.com/llmnr-poisoning-and-how-to-prevent-it/

title: Windows.Forensics.Trawler
author: joeavanzato
description:
Trawler [https://github.com/joeavanzato/Trawler] is a PowerShell script designed to help Incident
Responders rapidly identify potential adversary persistence mechanisms on Windows.  It is similar
in nature to PersistenceSniper with additional targeted checks as well as the capability to operate
against a 'dead box' (mounted drive). The output is simplified compared to PersistenceSniper, providing
the user with the details needed to kick off an investigation into any identified mechanisms.
Think of these tools as autoruns on steroids.

title: Windows.Scanner.Yara.Parsed
author: mgreen27
description:
Instructions: Upload a yara signature file (signature file must be named yara.yas) and yara64.exe in a single zip file called yara.zip.
This artifact is an alternative way to scan processes, or recursively scan the C:\ with a yara file containing multiple yara rules, utilizing the official yara tool.

title: Windows.Forensics.AdvancedPortScanner
author: y0sh1mitsu
description:
This Velociraptor artifact is tailored for forensics analysis of Angry IP Scanner usage on Windows platforms. This facilitates the identification of how Angry IP Scanner was configured and used, aiding in DFIR investigations. It examines registry keys HKEY_USERS\\*\\SOFTWARE\\Famatech\\advanced_port_scanner and HKEY_USERS\\*\\SOFTWARE\\Famatech\\advanced_port_scanner\\State for retrieve some informations about:
   
- run: Displays the version of Advanced Port Scanner
- locale_timestamp: Indicates the time in EPOCH (UTC +0) at which the application was first launched
- locale: Displays the language chosen for the graphical interface, may prove useful to have an idea of the native language of a threat actor (it is necessary to correlate with a modus operandi in order not to fall into the trap of a false flag)
- LastPortsUsed: Displays the last ports used in the last scan
- LastRangeUsed: Displays the last IP range used in the last scan
- IpRangesMruList: Displays all the IP ranges scanned by the tool, the first digit of each prefix in this list indicates the frequency of scans for each range
- PortsMruList: Displays all the ports that have been scanned by the tool, the first digit of each prefix in this list indicates the frequency of scans for each port
- SearchMruList: Displays all the IP addresses or hostnames that have been searched using the GUI's "search" feature

title: Windows.Forensics.AngryIPScanner
author: y0sh1mitsu
description:
This Velociraptor artifact is tailored for forensic analysis of Angry IP Scanner usage on Windows platforms. This facilitates the identification of how Angry IP Scanner was configured and used, aiding in DFIR investigations. It examines HKEY_USERS\\*\\SOFTWARE\\JavaSoft\\Prefs\\ipscan from the registry for retrieve some informations about:
  
  - language: Displays the language used in the GUI, may prove useful to have an idea of the language used by a threat actor (it is necessary to correlate with a modus operandi in order not to fall into the trap of a false flag)
  - Version: Displays the version of Angry IP Scanner
  - LastVersionCheck: Captures the last time (EPOCH format in UTC +0) when the application checked for an update
  - PortScanConfiguration: Displays the selected ports for scanning

title: Windows.Forensics.SoftPerfectNetworkScanner
author: y0sh1mitsu
description: This Velociraptor artifact is tailored for forensic analysis of SoftPerfect Network Scanner (NetScan) usage on Windows platforms. This facilitates the identification of how SoftPerfect Network Scanner was configured and used, aiding in DFIR investigations. It parse the MFT to search and retrieve the content of two files:

title: Windows.Forensics.ThumbCache
author: mgreen27
description: ThumbCache_xx.db parser.

title: Windows.Forensics.TabState
author: mgreen27
description: This artifact parses notepad TabState files in available in Windows 11.

title: Windows.Triage.ScreenConnect
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact extracts useful data for triage of ConnectWise ScreenConnect
CVE-2024-1709 and CVE-2024-1708 impacting versions 23.9.7 and prior.

title: Windows.Audit.CISCat_Lite
author: ablescia
description: This artifact runs the CISCat-Lite tool on the target machine and uploads the html output on the velociraptor server.

title: Generic.Detection.WebShells
author: sec-hbaer
description:
This artifact looks for evidence of a web shell being present on the system. It targets Windows and Linux hosts.
The artifact should be run on web servers, be it dedicated web servers or systems with integrated web servers. 
For such machines, find the root directory of the web server and change the artifact parameters as needed.

title: Windows.Forensics.Jumplists_JLECmd
author: orhan-emre
description:
* Execute Eric Zimmerman's JLECmd to parse AUTOMATICDESTINATIONS-MS and CUSTOMDESTINATIONS-MS files in C:\ drive recursively and return output for analysis. (jlecmd.exe -d C:/ --csvf -csv tmpdir results.csv).
* JLECmd.zip is downloaded from the URL to 'C:\Program Files\Velociraptor\Tools' folder.
* JLECmd.zip can be uploaded to Velociraptor Server in order to copy it to the clients in case there is no internet connection.
* Created using @carlos_cajigas LECmd VQL as a quide.
* JLECmd is a CLI tool for analyzing Custom Destinations jump list data. Learn more - https://github.com/EricZimmerman/JLECmd

title: Windows.Mounted.Mass.Storage
author: hasamba
description: Find drives/usb mass storage that were mounted

title: Windows.Registry.ScheduledTasks
author: mgreen27
description:
This artefact will collect Scheduled task information from the registry without 
relying on the existance of an XML file in C:\\Windows\\System32\\Tasks.

title: Generic.Detection.Yara.SSH
author: mgreen27
description:
This is a server artifact that enables running Generic.Detection.Yara.Glob 
over ssh.

title: Windows.Veeam.RestorePoints.MetadataFiles
author: cybiosity-syn
description: Parses the metadata found in Veeam backup chain metadata files (`.vbm`) to extract relevant fields for each Restore Point.

title: Generic.Detection.Confluence_CVE_2023_22527
author: mgreen27
description: This artifact detects evidence of exploitation of Confluence RCE CVE-2023-22527.

title: Windows.Forensics.PersistenceSniper
author: ablescia
description:
PersistenceSniper is a Powershell module that can be used by Blue Teams, Incident
Responders and System Administrators to hunt persistences implanted in Windows machines.
It is also available on Powershell Gallery and it is digitally signed with a valid code
signing certificate. The tool is under active development with new releases coming out
regularly, so make sure to use the up-to-date version.
https://github.com/last-byte/PersistenceSniper

title: Generic.Detection.EffluenceWebshell
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact detects Effluence Webshell observed deployed during exploitation 
of Atlassian Confluence CVE-2023-22515.

title: Server.Import.WatchLocalDirectory
author: bmcder02
description:
This is an artifact that will monitor a local path for collections, 
which it will then ingest.

title: Server.Import.WatchS3Directory
author: bmcder02
description:
This is an artifact that will monitor an S3 path for collections, 
which it will then ingest.

title: Windows.Detection.SysAid
author: mgreen27
description:
Detects artifacts associated with post exploitation activity of 
LaceTempest related to the SysAid 0day.

title: Windows.Sys.BitLocker
author: zaneGittins
description: This artifact gets all Bitlocker volumes using PowerShell, including the recovery password.

title: Windows.Applications.FreeFileSync
author: freeze-syn
description:
This artefact can be used to retrieve and parse some FreeFileSync file in order to:
- Identify the latest account used to transfer data and the remote ip adresse destination in the case of SFTP protocol with the qeury GlobalInfo
- Identify the latest transfered files with Latest Data Transfer
- Identify the presence of others interesting logs about previous or attempt of files transfer

title: Windows.Applications.GoodSync
author: freeze-syn

title: Windows.Sys.LoggedInUsers
author: zaneGittins
description: Get all currently logged in users via WMI.

title: Server.Utils.ScheduledDeletion
author: zaneGittins
description: Schedules Server.Utils.DeleteMonitoringData to cleanup server monitoring data.

title: Windows.Detection.Network.Changed
author: zaneGittins
description: Detects when a new network is added or removed from the system via the NetworkList registry keys.

title: Linux.Memory.AVML
author: Zawadidone
description:
Acquires a full memory image in LiME output format. We download
avml and use it to acquire a full memory image.
NOTE: This artifact usually transfers a lot of data. You should
increase the default timeout to allow it to complete.

title: Windows.Services.Hijacking
author: Sam0rai
description:
Service Executable Hijacking is a misconfiguration flaw, where a service runs an executable which has 
overly permissive permissions on it (for example: "Full Control" permissions to "Authenticated Users").
If a service runs under the security context of a user with high permissions (such as: NT Authority\SYSTEM), 
and an attacker with low privileges is able to modify the executable that service is running (such as 
replacing it with their own) - the service could run that executable with high privileges.

title: Windows.Forensics.UEFI.BootApplication
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact parses Windows MeasuredBoot TCGLogs to extract PathName of 
EV_EFI_Boot_Services_Application events, which can assist detection of 
potential ESP based persistance.

title: Linux.Detection.IncorrectPermissions
author: misje
description:
NOTE: Requires velociraptor 0.7.1 or higher. – Alternatively, import the
artifact dependency Linux.Sys.Groups manually into your installation.

title: Windows.Registry.HVCI
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact will return the Enabled KeyValue in the Hypervisor-protected Code 
Integrity (HVCI) registry path. An adversary may set the Enabled key to 0 
if they intend to manipulate UEFI boot process.

title: MacOS.Forensics.KnockKnock
author: mgreen27
description: This artifact will run Knocknock to collect autorun output.

title: IPCheck.Virustotal
author: AdrianX21
description: Submit a IP to Virustotal. Default Public API restriction is 4 requests/min (Inspired on Virustotal file Check created by Wes Lambert -- @therealwlambert).

title: Linux.Network.NM.Connections
author: misje
description:
NetworkManager is a popular high-level interface for configuring
networks in Linux systems, in particular Ubuntu and other Debian-based
flavours. This artifact lists the NetworkManager state, all configured
connections and their settings, as well as when the connections were
last activated. A list of BSSIDs per connection is also retrieved.

title: Windows.Timeline.Prefetch.Improved
author: scudette
description:
NOTE: This is a fixed version of Windows.Timeline.Prefetch which is
available in the release binary after 0.7.0-3.

title: Windows.Detection.WS_FTP
author: mgreen27
description:
This is an artifact to detect exploitation of a Progress Software's WS_FTP 
critical vulnerability observed in the wild.

title: Windows.Detection.IdatLoader
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact enables running Yara over processes in memory.
Targeting detection of IDAT Loader and final payloads 
observed in field.

title: Server.Utils.BackupAzure
author: zaneGittins
description:
This server monitoring artifact will automatically zip and backup
any collected artifacts to Azure blob storage.

title: Windows.EventLogs.RemoteAccessVPN
author: ekt0-syn
description:
This Artifact enables scoping EventLogs from Microsoft VPN, served by 
Remote Access Service server role. 
It is designed to assist in identifying VPN connections on organizations that 
are using Microsoft VPN service. It targets both server and client side logs.

title: Linux.Debian.GPGKeys
author: misje
description: Extract keys, fingerprints and identities from GPG keys.

title: Windows.Events.TrackProcesses.UseExistingSysmonOnly
author: SBattaglia-R7
description:
**This is a modified version of Windows.Events.TrackProcesses for servers
that do not use the Inventory service.  It assumes that Sysmon
is already installed and running. The option to forward updates to the server
is also removed.**

title: Linux.PrivilegeEscalationDetection
author: leogrossi
description: This artifact searches for potential privilege escalation indicators on Linux systems. It identifies processes running as root that were spawned by processes not running as root, which could indicate unauthorized privilege escalation. Created by Leonardo Grossi.

title: Generic.Forensics.CyLR
author: tsauter
description: Uses CyLR tool to do live forensic on the host.

title: Windows.Registry.DefenderConfig
author: mgreen27
description:
Thit artifact enables extracting Windows Defender configuration from 
SOFTWARE registry hive.

title: Server.Alerts.Mattermost
author: misje
description: Create a Slack/Mattermost notification when a client Flow (with artifacts of interest) has finished. Cancelled collections and collections with artifacts that don't satisfy preconditions do not create notifications when they are stopped.

title: Custom.Windows.Nirsoft.LastActivityView
author: hasamba
description: LastActivityView is a tool for Windows operating system that collects information from various sources on a running system, and displays a log of actions made by the user and events occurred on this computer. The activity displayed by LastActivityView includes: Running .exe file, Opening open/save dialog-box, Opening file/folder from Explorer or other software, software installation, system shutdown/start, application or system crash, network connection/disconnection and more...

title: Windows.Registry.PrintNightmare
author: DakshGajjar
description: CVE-2021-34527 or Windows Print Spooler Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

title: Exchange.Linux.Kunai
author: weslambert
description: Kunai is a Linux-based security monitoring and threat hunting tool written in Rust.  This artifact parses the Kunai log file.

title: Linux.Detection.SSHKeyFileCmd
author: 4ltern4te
description:
This artifact will parse ~/.ssh/authorized_keys and ~/.ssh/id_*.pub looking for the command option
to detect potential persistence

title: Linux.Detection.MemFD
author: 4ltern4te
description:
This artifact will parse /proc/*/exe files and look for processes 
 that have been executed from memory via memfd_create()

title: IRIS.Timeline.Add
author: BadBloopZ
description: Adds Velociraptor rows as timeline entries to [DFIR-IRIS](https://dfir-iris.org/).

title: Windows.EventLogs.MoveIt
author: mgreen27
description:
This Artifact enables scoping EventLogs from Progress Software's MoveIT File 
Transfer. It is designed to assist in identifying exfiltration resulting from
the exploitation of CVE-2023-34362

title: Windows.Detection.MoveIt
author: mgreen27
description:
This is an artifact to detect exploitation of a MoveIt critical vulnerability 
observed in the wild. CVE-2023-34362

title: Server.Enrichment.Strelka.FileScan
author: weslambert
description: Submit a file to Strelka for analysis using `strelka-oneshot`.

title: Windows.Forensics.RecentFileCache
author: BadBloopZ
description: Parses the RecentFileCache as evidence of execution artifact existing on older Windows systems (<= Win 7).

title: Windows.Applications.LECmd
author: CarlosCajigas
description:
Execute Eric Zimmerman's LECmd and return output for analysis.
Created using @eduardfir SBECmd VQL as a quide.  
LECmd is a CLI tool for analyzing lnk data. Learn more - https://github.com/EricZimmerman/LECmd

title: PSList.VTLookup
author: Shad0wCell
description: Combination of PSList with Virus Total reputation lookup using the Virus Total Server Enrichment Artifact by Wes Lambert.

title: Server.Alerts.Monitor.IRIS
author: weslambert
description:
Create an IRIS alert when monitored artifacts complete with results. Alerts are available starting in version 2.1.0 of IRIS.
https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/releases/tag/v2.1.0

title: Server.Notification.Mattermost
author: hillu
description: Send notification via Mattermost webhook as described in <https://developers.mattermost.com/integrate/webhooks/incoming/>

title: MacOS.System.Man
author: weslambert
description: `man` is typically used to provide information about how to use various commands. It's configuration file is located at `/private/etc/man.conf` on most macOS systems.

title: Windows.Generic.Internet.BlockAccess
author: tuedenn
description: Simply adds a new inbound or outbound firewall rule that filters traffic by allowing or blocking network packets that match the specified criteria via `netsh advfirewall add rule` command. Applicable in case of blocking Internet access.

title: Windows.Forensics.Clipboard
author: h-adwan
description: This artifact will show the Clipboard activity.

title: MacOS.Logs.MacMonitor
author: weslambert
description: This artifact parses JSONL-formatted logs generated by MacMonitor.

title: Alert.Windows.EVTX.PowerPickHostVersion
author: SBattaglia-R7
description:
This artifact by itself only indicates that the PowerPick tool may have
been invoked on the client. To capture additional context, ensure that
Powershell script block and module logging are enabled on the clients and
deploy the Windows.ETW.Powershell artifact from the Exchange.

title: Windows.Carving.BumbleBee
author: angelovioletti
description: This artficat will detect running BumbleBee processes and subsequently extract the command and control servers with the destination port 443.

title: Server.Telegram.Clients.Enrolled
author: tuedenn
description: Send a message to telegram when clients become enrolled.

title: Windows.Registry.Domain
author: angry-bender
description: Checks the configured domain name on each endpoint

title: Windows.Carving.Qakbot
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact enables Qakbot payload detection and configuration extraction 
from a byte stream, process or file on disk. The artifact runs a yara scan 
as a detection step, then attempts to process the payload to extract 
configuration.

title: MacOS.Applications.Firefox.History
author: x64-julian
description: Read all Users Firefox history.

title: Windows.Detection.SmoothOperator
author: mgreen27
description: This artifact searches for evidence of trojanised 3CXDesktopApp.

title: Detection.Application.CursedChrome
author: mattdri-ir
description: Detects the [Cursed Chrome](https://github.com/mandatoryprogrammer/CursedChrome) extension. Starts by searching for permissive extensions configured within `Secure Preferences`. Locates the path of the extensions and scans using Yara.

title: Windows.Detection.RemoteIconForcedAuth
author: acedef
description:
Attackers plant SCF, URL, and LNK files with malicious icon file paths
on file shares to escalate privileges or maintain persistence. This attack 
only requires the user to browse to the location of the malicious file.
This artifact enumerates file shares and returns an event for each file with a
remote icon. It can also scan a target root directory since attackers commonly
use other locations like desktops.

title: Windows.Registry.Bulk.ComputerName
author: angry-bender
description: This looks through registry on all disks to determine the hostname for cases where multiple disks are mounted

title: Linux.LogAnalysis.ChopChopGo
author: weslambert
description: This artifact leverages ChopChopGo to enable usage of Sigma rules to faciliate detection within Linux logs.

title: Windows.Detection.ScmanagerBackdoor
author: acedef
description:
Checks for overly permissive DACLs on scmanager. Low priv Users with
KA - SDDL_KEY_ALL could launch SYSTEM services.

title: Server.Enrichment.Sublime.EmailAnalysis
author: weslambert
description: Submit an email to Sublime for analysis.

title: Windows.Memory.InjectedThreadEx
author: mgreen27
description: This artifact runs Get-InjetedThreadEx to detect process injection and hooking.

title: Generic.Collection.UAC
author: tclahr
description:
This artifact leverages UAC (Unix-like Artifacts Collector) to collect artifacts
from Unix-like systems, and then upload the output to the Velociraptor server.

title: Windows.Detection.PipeHunter
author: acedef
description:
Takes a pipe name and returns the owning process and access rights. The primary
motivation for this artifact is a vulnerability in RemCom. RemCom is most 
notably used by impacket psexec.py. It creates a null DACL for its 
communication pipe. This means a low privileged user
could use a stale pipe to get remote execution as SYSTEM. If you uncover any
named pipes with the name RemCom_communication, investigate the owning proc
and remove it from the system.
#impacket

title: Linux.Detection.vRealizeLogInsightExploitation
author: acedef
description:
Checks for exploitation of vRealize Log Insight VMSA-2023-0001 exploitation 
artifacts. The presence of a path traversal in the FileName field
is evidence of compromise. There is still a path to exploitation without
leveraging the path traversal vuln. Any attempt to run
REMOTE_PAK_DOWNLOAD_COMMAND from a non-vRealize server is malicious.
#VMWare #vRealize #exploit

title: Windows.Detection.Onenote
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact enables detection of malicious .one files and can also be used 
as an embedded file and metadata parser.

title: Windows.Persistence.VscodeTasks
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact parses VSCode configuration files to find potenital 
persistence.

title: Windows.MobaXterm.Passwords
author: Sam0rai
description:
Extract MobaXterm encrypted saved Master Passwords, Passwords and Credentials from registry.
Further information regarding decryption can be found here: https://www.xmcyber.com/blog/extracting-encrypted-credentials-from-common-tools-2/

title: Server.Utils.DeleteClientLabel
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact completely removes a client from the data store if a configured 
label is set.

title: Windows.Detection.PublicIP
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact queries for RDP and Authentication events with a Public IP 
source. The artifact uses Windows.EventLogs.RDPAuth and has several built in 
notebooks for analysis.

title: Windows.WinSCP.Passwords
author: Sam0rai
description:
Extract WinSCP obfuscated saved passwords from registry.
Further information regarding deobfuscation can be found here: https://www.xmcyber.com/blog/extracting-encrypted-credentials-from-common-tools-2/

title: Generic.Detection.ManageEngineLog
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact will enable discovery of logs associated with observed exploitation 
of critical ManageEngine vulnerability: CVE-2022-47966.

title: Windows.Detection.ProxyHunter
author: mgreen27
description: This artifact detects evidence of several common proxy tools.

title: Windows.Applications.KACE_SW_Process
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact parses the KACE software monitoring sqlite database - ksw_process.db
which provides excellent third party evidence of execution that may 
be useful during investigation or detection work.

title: Linux.Collection.Autoruns
author: 4ltern4te
description:
This artifact collects various autorun files for upload.
Based on TriagePersistence from forensicartifacts.com

title: Linux.Collection.BrowserExtensions
author: 4ltern4te
description:
Collect Browser Extensions and upload them.
Based on TriageWebBrowserExtensions from forensicartifacts.com

title: Linux.Collection.BrowserHistory
author: 4ltern4te
description:
Collect Browser History and upload them.
Based on TriageWebBrowserHistory from forensicartifacts.com

title: Linux.Collection.DBConfig
author: 4ltern4te
description:
Collect database configurations and upload them.
Based on TriageDatabaseConfigsAndLogs from forensicartifacts.com

title: Linux.Collection.History
author: 4ltern4te
description:
Collect history files from unix/linux utilities and upload them.
Based on TriageHistory from forensicartifacts.com

title: Linux.Collection.NetworkConfig
author: 4ltern4te
description:
Collect network config files and upload them.
Based on TriageNetwork from forensicartifacts.com

title: Linux.Collection.SysConfig
author: 4ltern4te
description:
Collect system configurations and upload them.
Based on TriageSystemConfiguration from forensicartifacts.com

title: Linux.Collection.SysLogs
author: 4ltern4te
description:
Collect system logs and upload them.
Based on TriageSystemLogs from forensicartifacts.com

title: Linux.Collection.UserConfig
author: 4ltern4te
description:
Collect user configurations and upload them.
Based on TriageUserConfiguration from forensicartifacts.com

title: Windows.System.AppCompatPCA
author: ecapuano
description: Parse the Program Compatibility Assistant launch dictionary for executable launch times.

title: Windows.Detection.WonkaVision
author: weslambert
description: This artifact analyzes Kerberos tickets and attempts to determine if they are forged, using WonkaVision by @4ndr3w6s and @exploitph.

title: Windows.EventLogs.WonkaVision
author: weslambert
description: Collect WonkaVision logs from Windows hosts.

title: MacOS.UnifiedLogHunter
author: weslambert
description: This artifact allows for live hunting through Apple's Unified Logs using the native `log` command.

title: Linux.System.BashLogout
author: weslambert
description: Capture Bash logout files for examination of abnormal activity.

title: MacOS.Applications.Notes
author: weslambert
description: This artifact provides details about notes taken using the default Notes application on macOS.  These notes can be useful during an investigation, especially if tied to interesting files.

title: Windows.Detection.TeamViewerLanguage
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact enables collection of TeamViewer log entries for keyboard layout 
changes.

title: MacOS.Network.DHCP
author: weslambert
description: It can be useful to view DHCP lease information on an endpoint.  If the  `LeaseLength`, `RouterIPAddress`, `SSID`, or other values are not as expected,  it could potentially indicate a rogue DHCP server on the network, or just misconfiguration.

title: IRIS.Sync.Asset
author: BadBloopZ
description: Synchronizes client information from Velociraptor to [DFIR-IRIS](https://dfir-iris.org/).

title: Linux.Forensics.RecentlyUsed
author: Seeps
description: Parses the 'recently-used.xbel' XML file for all standard Linux users.

title: Linux.System.PAM
author: weslambert
description: This artifact enumerates applicable lines from the files that reside in `/etc/PAM.d/`. This information can be useful for auditing and compliance purposes, or to identify suspicious activity on Linux systems.

title: MacOS.Applications.SavedState
author: weslambert
description: On macOS, certain application state is saved in `/Users/*/Library/Saved Application State/`.

title: Server.Enrichment.OpenAI
author: weslambert
description: Query OpenAI for analysis of data.

title: Server.Alerts.GenericMonitor
author: mgreen27
description: This is a template artifact to allow alerting on a monitoring artifact.

title: Linux.Sys.APTHistory
author: weslambert
description: APT (Advanced Package Tool) maintains a log of software installation/removal/upgrades, as well as associated command-line invocations.

title: MacOS.System.MountedDiskImages
author: weslambert
description: This artifact checks for mounted disk images using the `hdiutil` command.

title: Windows.Remediation.Glob
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact uses glob to remove a file or folder.  
To recursively target a folder: ```C:\folder\path{,\**}```  
To target multiple folders: ```C:\{folder2\path2{,\**},folder\path{,\**}}``` 
however advised to just run 2 collections...   
  
 WARNING: There has been a bug in older versions of Velociraptor that ```\**```
 glob path will select all files. PLEASE SCOPE FIRST and use appropriate targeting.

title: Linux.Sys.JournalCtl
author: weslambert
description: Parse the output of the journalctl command. Journalctl is an interface to the systemd journal, which records information about system events.

title: MacOS.Applications.NetworkUsage
author: weslambert
description: On macOS, the NetUsage DB can provide various details around application network utilization. With this artifact, we can get an idea of what applications are utilizing the network for communications and to what degree. We can also identify if usage has occurred through a WIFI network or a wired network.

title: Windows.Remediation.Process
author: mgreen27
description: This artifact enables killing a process by Name, Path or PID.

title: Windows.Remediation.Registry
author: mgreen27
description: This artifact uses glob to remove a registry key.

title: MacOS.Applications.KnowledgeC
author: weslambert
description: On macOS, the KnowledgeC DB can provide various details around application activities and usage, as well as device power status.

title: Windows.EventLogs.EvtxHussar
author: yarox24
description:
Grab important events from Windows logs (.evtx) using [EvtxHussar](https://github.com/yarox24/EvtxHussar).
Also upload PowerShell ScriptBlocks (reconstructed as files).

title: Server.Notification.Mastodon
author: weslambert
description: Create a post on a Mastodon server. This could be used for automated alerting purposes, sharing IOCs, etc.

title: MacOS.Applications.Cache
author: weslambert
description: Applications can use the NSURL cache to store specific data that is useful to the operation of the application in a `Cache.db` file on disk. The data contained within this file could potentially be useful to investigators or incident responders, such as URLs that were accessed, as well as data requested or returned.

title: Windows.Triage.Sysmon
author: mgreen27
description: This artifact allows collecting Sysmon Events for Triage around a timestamp.

title: Server.Import.DetectRaptor
author: mgreen27
description:
DetectRaptor is a collection of publicly availible Velociraptor detection content. 
Most content is managed by a series of csv files and artifacts are automatically updated.

title: MacOS.Sys.BashHistory
author: weslambert
description: This artifact is a modified version of the Linux.Sys.BashHistory artifact that enables grep of Bash and alternate shell history and *session* files.

title: Windows.Detection.Termsrv
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact detects patched TerminalService / Remote Desktop (RDP) dynamic link library or ServiceDll - 
termsrv.dll.

title: MacOS.Sys.Automator
author: weslambert
description: This artifact collects information about Automator actions and workflows.

title: Linux.Sys.SystemdTimer
author: weslambert
description: List and parse content of Systemd timers.

title: Windows.EventLogs.RPCFirewall
author: weslambert
description: Collect RPC Firewall logs from Windows hosts

title: MacOS.Network.ApplicationLayerFirewall
author: weslambert
description: This artifact provides information around the configuration of the application firewall for a macOS host.

title: Server.Utils.QuerySummary
author: clayscode
description: Takes a query and outputs number of unique items per column, as well as the top 10 most frequently occuring items

title: Windows.EventLogs.Aurora
author: weslambert
description: This artifact is a wrapper around the Windows.EventLogs.EvtxHunter artifact. It searches the Windows Application event log for logs being written by Nextron System's Aurora/Aurora Lite ('AuroraAgent' provider).

title: MacOS.Network.Bluetooth
author: weslambert
description: Collect information about connected or paired Bluetooth-enabled devices.

title: Windows.Carving.SystemBC
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact extracts SystemBC RAT configuration from a byte stream, 
process or file on disk.

title: MacOS.Network.RecentWifiNetworks
author: weslambert
description:
This artifact looks for recent Wifi networks to which a host has joined. This can be useful in determining where a machine has been, or if a user has joined an illegitimate or unauthorized wireless network.
*Tested on macOS Monterey

title: Server.Monitor.Autolabeling.Clients
author: BadBloopZ
description: This server side event monitoring artifact watches for new client enrollments and automatically labels them according to their domain roles.

title: Windows.Applications.AnyDesk
author: DfirJos
description: This parses AnyDesk logs to retrieve information about AnyDesk usage. It includes source IP addresses, AnyDesk ID's, and filetransfers.

title: Windows.Carving.BRc4
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact extracts Brute Ratel C4 (BRc4) configuration from a byte stream, 
process or file on disk. BRc4 is an emerging red-teaming and adversarial 
attack simulation tool.

title: MacOS.Collection.Aftermath
author: weslambert
description: This is a simple artifact that leverages Afermath to collect many different forensic artifacts from a macOS host, then uploads the results to the Velociraptor server.

title: Windows.Triage.HighValueMemory
author: weslambert
description: Dump process memory and upload to the server

title: Windows.Detection.ISOMount
author: cquinn-r7
description:
Following Microsoft's decision to block macros by default on MS Office applications, threat actors are increasingly using container files such as ISO files to distribute malware. 
This artifact will extract evidence of container files being mounted that may be malicious from the Microsoft-Windows-VHDMP-Operational EventLog. 
The artifact targets the string ".(iso|vhd|vhdx|img)$" in event IDs: 1 (mount), 2 (unmount) and 12 (type, path, handle).

title: MacOS.ParallelsVM.SuspendedMemory
author: DoppioRistretto
description: Looks for suspended Parallels VM owned by any user on a MacOS system. Can automatically upload the virtual memory files if found.

title: Windows.Detection.Malfind
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact checks the VAD for executable sections that are not maped to disk 
and has suspicious content which may indicate process injection.

title: Windows.ETW.Powershell
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact enables Powershell scriptblock and commandlet load monitoring.  
It uses the ETW provider: Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell

title: MacOS.UnifiedLogParser
author: weslambert
description: This is a simple, un-optimized artifact that leverages Mandiant's `macos-unifiedlogs`/`unifiedlog_parser` to obtain parsed log information from macOS's Unified Log.

title: Windows.ETW.DNSOfflineCollector
author: DfirJos
description:
This artifact collects DNS queries for a specified duration. It can be used 
with an Offline Collector (which is not the case with Windows.ETW.DNS).
It uses the artifact (Windows.ETW.DNS) that was built by Matt Green - @mgreen27

title: Server.Alerts.IRIS.Case.Create
author: weslambert
description: Create an IRIS case when monitored artifacts complete with results.  Adds the ClientId, FlowId as tags to the case.  Adds the FQDN as an asset.

title: Server.Enrichment.IRIS.IOCLookup
author: weslambert
description: Query an IRIS instance for an indicator.

title: Windows.Registry.COMAutoApprovalList
author: weslambert
description: This artifact will return COM objects that auto-elevate and bypass UAC (these could potentially be used by adversaries/malware to elevate privileges), and cross-reference the class ID with a name where able.

title: Windows.Detection.MagicWeb
author: mgreen27
description: This artifact will find evidence of NOBELIUM’s MagicWeb.

title: Windows.System.Services.SliverPsexec
author: svch0stz
description: This pack detects various artefacts left behind by default configurations of the C2 framework Sliver PsExec module

title: Windows.Detection.UnattendXML
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact will find unscrubbed passwords in unattend.xml answer files. This 
file is used for non interactive Windows installation.

title: Linux.Remediation.Quarantine.IPTables
author: weslambert
description: Quarantine a Linux host using iptables rules.

title: MacOS.Files.FileMonitor
author: weslambert
description: This artifact parses Objective-See's FileMonitor log.

title: MacOS.Network.LittleSnitch
author: weslambert
description: This is artifact parses Little Snitch's network traffic log.

title: Windows.Detection.Ntdsutil
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact will extract evidence of Ntdsutil abuse from the application 
eventlog. The artifact targets the string "ntds.dit" in event IDs: 216, 325,
326 and 327.

title: Windows.KapeFiles.Remapping
author: scudette
description:
This artifact automates the rebuilding of remapping rules to be able to easily
post process the results of the Windows.KapeFiles.Targets.

title: Server.Enrichment.MalwareBazaar
author: weslambert
description: Query MalwareBazaar for a hash.

title: Server.Enrichment.ThreatFox
author: weslambert
description: Query ThreatFox for an indicator.

title: Windows.Sysinternals.SysmonArchive
author: mgreen27
description:
If configured, Sysmon EID 23: FileDelete enables archiving file deletes on 
disk. The challenges of this configuration is management of the archive 
folder which can grow to be significant size and use up disk space.

title: Windows.Events.SysmonArchiveMonitor
author: mgreen27
description: This artifact enables automatic management of the Sysmon archive folder.

title: Server.Utils.OrphanedFlows
author: scudette
description:
Sometimes flows are deleted but there is still outstanding data for
them in flight. The server will continue to save this data after the
flow is deleted.

title: Windows.System.WindowsErrorReporting
author: svch0stz
description: Parses several Windows Error Reporting (WER) files that contain information about crashed programs.

title: Windows.Analysis.SuspiciousWMIConsumers
author: AmgdGocha
description:
This artifact reports suspicious WMI Event Consumers and their associated Filters
that may indicate a malicious abuse for persistence.

title: Windows.Detection.BruteRatel
author: flukes86
description: This hunt runts the Immersive Labs yara rule (https://github.com/Immersive-Labs-Sec/BruteRatel-DetectionTools/blob/main/BruteRatel.yar) across select files to identify the known Brute Ratel config strings.

title: Windows.Remediation.KillProcess
author: mgreen27
description:
Quick and dirty monitoring artifact to kill a process by Image Name.
We monitor the Microsoft-Windows-Kernel-Process ETW provider and leverage 
taskkill to kill the process.

title: Windows.Events.SysmonRegistry
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact enables monitoring for registry events of interest via the Sysmon 
ETW proiver.

title: Exchange.Server.Enrichment.Gimphash
author: weslambert
description: Calculate the Gimphash for a Golang binary.

title: Windows.Forensics.FileZilla
author: dkelly-r7
description:
This artifact enumerate's all user directories on a system and will
parse three files within a users AppData\Roaming\FileZilla
directory: filezilla.xml, recentservers.xml, and queue.sqlite3

title: Server.Enrichment.EchoTrail
author: ecapuano
description:
This is a process execution enrichment artifact that can be called from within another artifact (such as one looking at running processes) to enrich the 
data made available by that artifact. We are calling the EchoTrail v2 API which is still in beta.

title: Label.DomainController
author: scudette
description:
This artifact watches for completion of the `watchArtifact`
and assigns the given `setLabel` if the `WHERE` condition is matched.

title: Windows.EventLogs.Hayabusa
author: ecapuano
description:
[Hayabusa](https://github.com/Yamato-Security/hayabusa) is a
Windows event log fast forensics timeline generator and threat
hunting tool.

title: Windows.EventLogs.Bitsadmin
author: mgreen27
description:
This content will extract BITS Transfer events and enable filtering by URL 
and TLD.

title: Linux.Detection.ConfluenceLogs
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact enables grep of Linux logs and targets strings observed in 
exploitation of CVE-2022-26134.

title: Windows.Detection.MsdtFollina
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact will search Microsoft Support Diagnostic Tool logs for evidence 
of ms-msdt Follina exploitation (CVE-2022-30190).

title: Windows.Registry.NetshHelperDLLs
author: ecapuano
description: # Enumerate all NetSh Helper DLLs

title: Windows.EventLogs.LogonSessions
author: NorthwaveCERT
description:
This artifact searches for logon and logoff events within Security event logs identified
by Event ID 4624 and 4634. These logon/logoff events are grouped by "TargetLogonId" field
into "logon sessions". For each of these logon sessions, start, end and duration
are derived

title: Windows.System.Powershell.ISEAutoSave
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact hunts for Powershell ISE autosave files and extracts ISE user 
config.

title: Server.Enrichment.Virustotal.FileScan
author: weslambert
description: Submit a file to Virustotal for analysis.

title: Windows.Detection.PrefetchHunter
author: mgreen27
description: This artifact enables hunting prefetch entries for accessed files of interest.

title: Windows.Registry.TaskCache.HiddenTasks
author: svch0stz
description: This artefact will highlight any scheduled tasks missing the Security Descriptor (SD) value in the task cache. Without this value, the task is hidden from common query methods.

title: Windows.NTFS.Timestomp
author: mgreen27
description: This artifact enables triage to detect potential time stomped files.

title: Windows.Applications.DefenderQuarantineExtract
author: eduardomcm
description: Extracts Quarantine Files from Windows Defender.

title: Windows.Registry.CortexEDRDisabled
author: Rhysistance
description: This artifact will attempt to identify Cortex EDR that has been disabled via regkey

title: Windows.Applications.DefenderHistory
author: rmakuch
description:
This artifact parses the Windows Defender files generated on threat detection and returns
the contained parameters created by Windows Defender about the detected threat.

title: MacOS.Applications.Safari.Downloads
author: Seeps
description: Parses Safari downloads for all standard macOS users

title: Windows.EventLogs.RDPClientActivity
author: NorthwaveCERT
description:
This artifact retrieves outgoing RDP session activity from the
Microsoft-Windows-TerminalServices-RDPClient event logs. It aggregates
sessions based on ActivityID and outputs hostname, timeframe and disconnect reasons.
The latter is filled using a dict that was taken from MS Docs (see references)

title: Windows.Office.MRU
author: Sam0rai
description: This artifact enables hunting for recently used Office Documents.

title: MacOS.Applications.Safari.History
author: Seeps
description: Parses Safari history database

title: Windows.System.PowerEfficiencyDiagnostics
author: eduardomcm
description:
This artifact parses the XML Energy Reports from the Power Efficiency 
Diagnostics feature of Windows, returning the processes which had high 
CPU usage, including which

title: Windows.Registry.HiddenUsers
author: eduardomcm
description: Find hidden user accounts through registry values on the filesystem.

title: Windows.Applications.AnyDesk.LogParser
author: RHinDFIR
description: Parses the AnyDesk ad.trace log file.

title: Windows.EventLogs.CondensedAccountUsage
author: Qazeer
description: This artifact will extract condensed information on logon / logoff events.

title: MacOS.System.LocationServices
author: weslambert
description:
This artifact looks for applications that are registered and allowed for use of location services by checking the plist file in `/var/db/locationd/clients.plist`.  
This can be useful to help determine if these settings have been modified by an attacker to perform location tracking.

title: Linux.Detection.CVE20214034
author: scudette
description:
This artifact lists processes running as root that were spawns by processes that are not
running as root. This kind of behavior is normal for things like sudo or su but for other
processes (especially /bin/bash) it could represent a process launched via CVE-2021-4034.

title: Windows.Applications.DefenderDHParser
author: eduardomcm
description:
This artifact leverages Windows Defender DetectionHistory tool to parse and return
the parameters of Windows Defender detections contained in Detection History files.

title: Windows.System.WMIProviders
author: scudette
description: List the WMI providers in the system.

title: Windows.ETW.WMIEventing
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact collects events associated with creation and deletion of WMI 
Event Consumers. All Event Consumers created under any namespace will 
generate events which are filtered on event consumer classes.

title: Linux.Carving.SSHLogs
author: scudette
description:
Linux systems typically store audit events in syslog. In particular successful 
ssh logins are especially important for some investigations.

title: Linux.Sysinternals.SysmonEvent
author: scudette
description: Parses syslog for Sysmon events on Linux using a unix domain socket.

title: Windows.Registry.AteraNetworks
author: mgreen27
description:
Find AteraNetworks configuration details in the registry.
This artifact is best combined with Windows.Forensics.FilenameSearch 
searching for the string "atera".

title: Exchange.Label.User
author: scudette
description:
This artifact watches for new client enrolments and automatically
label the client with the required label if the user exists.

title: Generic.Detection.LunasecLog4shell
author: scudette
description:
Uses the Log4Shell scanner of Lunasec to scan the file systems of
all drives of the host for any sign of vulnerabilities related to
Log4shell

title: Server.Slack.Clients.Enrolled
author: scudette
description: Send a message to slack when clients become enrolled.

title: Windows.System.AccessControlList
author: scudette
description: This artifact displays the access control lists of files.

title: Windows.Detection.ProxyLogon.ProxyShell
author: Seeps
description:
This artifact hunts for CVE-2021-27065 (Microsoft Exchange ProxyLogon RCE)
and CVE-2021-31207 (Microsoft Exchange ProxyShell RCE) exploitation by parsing 
entries in the 'MSExchange Management.evtx' log.

title: Windows.Registry.CapabilityAccessManager
author: scudette
description:
The ConsentStore in CapabilityAccessManager can provide insight to
what resources binaries have had access to, such as the microphone
and webcam. This artefact returns non-Microsoft executables (ie:
entries listed in the `NonPackaged` path).

title: Generic.Detection.Log4jVulnHunter
author: mgreen27
description: This artifact searches for Vulnerable log4j libraries.

title: Generic.Detection.log4jRCE
author: mgreen27
description:
Detection for exploitation attempts against log4j RCE
vulnerability CVE-2021-44228.

title: Splunk.Events.Clients
author: jurelou
description:
This server monitoring artifact will watch a selection of client
monitoring artifacts for new events and push those to a splunk
index.

title: Windows.Monitor.USBPlugIn
author: mgreen27
description:
Monitor for plug in of USB volume.  Output drive letter for
additional enrichment artifacts

title: Windows.Detection.USBYara
author: mgreen27
description:
Run yara over usb when USB is plugged into machine.  Return context
and hit details.

title: Windows.EventLogs.Zircolite
author: weslambert
description:
Zircolite is a standalone tool that can be used to apply Sigma rules to EVTX files on endpoints in an effort to quickly parse large datasets and surface detections.
            
You can read more about Zircolite below:
    
https://github.com/wagga40/Zircolite
    
NOTE: This artifact may take several minutes to run, depending on the size of EVTX files being analyzed.

title: Server.Findflows
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact enables searching over client flow results with regex
and returns a link to the Flow for followup.

title: Linux.Collection.CatScale
author: weslambert
description:
This is a simple artifact that leverages Cat-Scale to collect many
different artifacts from a Linux host, then uploads the results to
the Velociraptor server.

title: Windows.Applications.DIEC
author: eduardomcm
description:
Execute DetectItEasy (console version) on specified paths and
return rows of results to hunt/filter on binaries based types of
files (E.g.: Packed binaries and its packers)

title: Windows.AttackSimulation.AtomicRedTeam
author: weslambert
description:
This artifact allows you to run Atomic Red Team tests on Windows
endpoints using Invoke-AtomicRedTeam. Linux and MacOS endpoints
will soon be supported.

title: Linux.Sysinternals.Sysmon
author: weslambert
description: Parses syslog for Sysmon events on Linux

title: Server.Analysis.CyberChefServer
author: weslambert
description: Analyze/transform data with CyberChef-server.

title: Windows.Carving.SquirrelWaffle
author: eduardomcm
description:
This artifact yara-scans memory or process dumps for unpacked
SquirrelWaffle Dlls, decodes the configuration and returns the C2s
and the payload.

title: Windows.Binary.Exports
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact can be used to extract all binary exports to research
potential lolbins.  Selecting the AllBinaryInfo tickbox will return
complete Binary information.

title: Windows.Applications.Cylance
author: mgreen27
description: Parse Cylance logs.

title: Windows.Applications.OfficeMacros.MacroRaptor
author: mgreen27
description: This artifact implements OleTools MacroRaptor capability in VQL.

title: Windows.Bulk.File
author: mgreen27
description:
Search for some simple bulk File IOCs and upload if desired.
Typical upload workflow may be to firstly search, then if returned
rows match expectations rerun query with upload tickbox selected.

title: Windows.System.BinaryVersion
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact will search the MFT for any matching filenames and return
binary details. This artifact can be used to find all instances of a 
binary on disk so its great for scoping both legititimate and illegitimate 
files.

title: Windows.Analysis.Capa
author: weslambert
description: Analyze PE, ELF, or shellcode files with capa.

title: Windows.Applications.OfficeServerCache
author: eduardomcm
description:
Return Office Internet Server Cache Registry keys and values in
order to identify possible C2 URLs from malicious opened Office
documents.

title: Linux.Applications.WgetHSTS
author: scudette
description:
Wget creates a HSTS log file in a user's home directory.  This can
contain forensically relevant information.

title: Windows.EventLogs.RecordIDCheck
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact will compare EventLog records and report on
abnormalities in RecordID sequence and optional time gap. The
artifact can be used for both hunting, remote or local analysis.

title: Windows.Registry.CVE_2021_40444
author: mgreen27
description:
This artifact will enable both application and removal of the
reccomended mitigation for CVE-2021-40444.

title: Windows.ETW.DetectProcessSpoofing
description:
Detects Process parent spoofing such as SelectMyParent.exe or
Cobalt Strike select PPID.
author: scudette

title: Windows.EventLogs.Chainsaw
description:
This artifact leverages Chainsaw to enable usage of Sigma rules
(in addition to built-in rules) to faciliate detection within
Windows Event Logs.
author: Wes Lambert - @therealwlambert

title: Windows.ActiveDirectory.PrivilegedUsers
description:
If on a Domain Controller (ProductType = 2), recursively enumerate
membership of privileged groups, then for each user, collect
details relevant to an investigation: Create Date, Last Logon,
Group Membership, SID
author: liteman

title: Windows.NTFS.MFT.HiveNightmare
description:
This artifact uses Windows.NTFS.MFT (By Matt Green - @mgreen27) to
find several files created as part of the POC tooling for
HiveNightmare (CVE-2021-36934):
author: svch0stz

title: Windows.Memory.HollowsHunter
author: mgreen27
description: Use hollows_hunter to detect suspicious process injections.

title: Windows.Monitoring.PrintNightmare
description:
This artifact returns ETW PrintService events for potential
PrintNightmare activity.  CVE-2021-1675 and CVE-2021-34527
author: mgreen27

title: Windows.System.PrinterDriver
description:
This artifact will enumerate installed PrintDrivers using the
Win32_PrinterDriver wmi class and parse each DriverPath, ConfigFile
and DataFile.
author: mgreen27

title: Windows.Remediation.PrintSpooler
description:
This artifact will enable mitigation of PrintSpooler exploitation
used by PrintNightmare - CVE-2021-34527 and CVE-2021-1675.
author: mgreen27

title: Linux.Memory.Acquisition
description:
Acquires a full memory image. We download LiME and use it to acquire
a full memory image.
author: makhno4n6

title: Linux.Volatility.Create.Profile
description: This artifact is used to create the profile to the environnements Debian / Ubuntu.
author: makhno4n6

title: Windows.Detection.PrintNightmare
description:
This artifact returns any binaries in the Windows/spool/drivers/**
folders with an untrusted Authenticode entry.
